article.headline: North Carolina State 78, Valparaiso 64
article.story: RALEIGH, N.C. (AP) -- Gavin Grant had a career-high 25 points and 12 rebounds to lead North Carolina State to a 78-64 win over Valparaiso on Tuesday night. Sidney Lowe improved to 3-0 as coach of the Wolfpack program he helped lead to a national title and denied Valparaiso (3-1) its first 4-0 start since the 1998-99 season. Brandon Costner had 17 points and Courtney Fells added a career-high 13 for N.C. State, which took control with a 25-2 burst which spanned halftime, led by as many as 29 and shot nearly 48 percent. The Wolfpack also put forth their second consecutive strong defensive performance, holding Valparaiso without a field goal for an 11-minute span and limiting the Crusaders to 29 percent shooting in the first half. Four days earlier, N.C. State held Delaware State to 34 percent shooting and a 4-for-21 showing from 3-point range in a 63-43 rout. Shawn Huff and Samuel Haanpaa had 14 points apiece and Urule Igbavboa added 10 for Valparaiso, which used a barrage of late 3-pointers to make the final score respectable. Dennis Horner started and Fells finished a 15-2 rally late in the first half which initially put N.C. State ahead to stay and then put the Wolfpack in control. Horner's basket in the lane put N.C. State ahead for good, and Fells scored the final nine points of the spurt with a 3, three free throws and a three-point play. That made it 41-27 with 1:30 until the break. Jake Diebler added two free throws late in the half to pull Valparaiso to 41-29 at halftime, but that was as close as the Crusaders would get. N.C. State started the second half with 10 consecutive points, a burst capped by Grant's 3-pointer from the right wing which made it 51-29. The Wolfpack held Valparaiso without a field goal during the final seven minutes of the first half and first four minutes of the second until Shawn Huff ended the drought with a reverse layup with 15:51 to play. By then, the Wolfpack led 51-31 and were in command. Valparaiso fell to 2-6 against the Atlantic Coast Conference, and was denied its first victory against the league since the Crusaders' overtime win against Florida State during its memorable run to the round of 16 in the 1998 NCAA tournament.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
